headline: Paramount bids higher for Warner Bros to block Netflix: source
summary:
STORY: Paramount has submitted a higher offer for Warner Bros Discovery in an attempt to derail a deal with Netflix. 

That’s according to a source familiar with the matter. 

The bidding war for one of Hollywood’s most coveted underscores a desire for dominance in the streaming-led market. 

With Warner Bros being home to HBO Max, and franchises including “Harry Potter” and “Game of Thrones”. 

The source said Paramount’s new bid, which improves its initial offer of $104.8 billion, seeks to address Warner Bros' concerns about the certainty of its financing.

Netflix, which offered to buy it for $27.75 per share or $82.7 billion, is allowed to match the latest bid from Paramount.

A Variety report said that the iconic studio was likely to take the Paramount offer under review while still recommending the Netflix pact to its shareholders.

Netflix has ample cash and could bump up its offer  - while Paramount's rival bid is backed by Oracle billionaire Larry Ellison.

Warner Bros shareholders were set to decide the fate of Netflix's offer on March 20.

A green light from investors would move the deal forward - but it’d still face intense scrutiny from U.S. and European competition authorities. 

These bodies must assess whether combining Netflix's global streaming power with Warner Bros' century-old studio assets would reduce competition or limit consumer choice.

headline: Warner Bros gets a new offer from Paramount in heated bidding war for the storied Hollywood studio
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery says it's reviewing a new takeover offer from Paramount but it continues to recommend a competing offer from Netflix to its shareholders.  Warner disclosed Tuesday that it had received a revised proposal after a seven-day window to renew talks with Paramount elapsed on Monday.  Skydance-owned Paramount confirmed that it had submitted a revised proposal, but did not provide further details on the latest bid.

content.title: Warner Bros gets a new offer from Paramount in heated bidding war for the storied Hollywood studio
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery says it's reviewing a new takeover offer from Paramount but it continues to recommend a competing offer from Netflix to its shareholders.  Warner disclosed Tuesday that it had received a revised proposal after a seven-day window to renew talks with Paramount elapsed on Monday.  Skydance-owned Paramount confirmed that it had submitted a revised proposal, but did not provide further details on the latest bid.

headline: PARAMOUNT CONFIRMS SUBMISSION OF REVISED PROPOSAL TO ACQUIRE WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY
summary: Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount") today confirmed it has submitted to the Board of Directors of Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") a revised proposal to acquire WBD. This submission follows a period of engagement with WBD after it received a seven-day waiver under its merger agreement with Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NFLX) to engage with Paramount.

content.title: PARAMOUNT CONFIRMS SUBMISSION OF REVISED PROPOSAL TO ACQUIRE WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY

(NASDAQ: NFLX) to engage with Paramount.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Confirms Receipt of Revised Proposal from Paramount Skydance
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ("Warner Bros. Discovery" or "WBD") (NASDAQ: WBD) today confirmed that it has received a revised proposal from Paramount Skydance Corporation ("Paramount Skydance" or "PSKY") (NASDAQ: PSKY) to acquire all of the outstanding shares of WBD common stock.

headline: Paramount, Netflix's bidding war 'underscores' Warner Bros. value
summary: Paramount Skydance (PSKY) has revised and ramped up its offer to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), challenging Netflix's (NFLX) own bid for the media giant. Sevens Report Research founder Tom Essaye, Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Ines Ferré, and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre all weigh in on whether Paramount's new deal is sweet enough for WBD to reconsider a sale to streamer Netflix. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Paramount, Netflix's bidding war 'underscores' Warner Bros. value
content.description:
Paramount Skydance (PSKY) has revised and ramped up its offer to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), challenging Netflix's (NFLX) own bid for the media giant.

Sevens Report Research founder Tom Essaye, Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Ines Ferré, and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre all weigh in on whether Paramount's new deal is sweet enough for WBD to reconsider a sale to streamer Netflix.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Warner Bros gets a new offer from Paramount in heated fight for the storied Hollywood studio
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery says it's reviewing a new takeover offer from Paramount, but it continues to recommend a competing proposal from Netflix to its shareholders in the meantime.  Warner disclosed Tuesday that it had received a revised offer from Paramount after a seven-day window to renew talks with the Skydance-owned company elapsed Monday.  Paramount confirmed it had submitted this proposal, but neither provided further details on the bid.

Warner disclosed Tuesday that it had received a revised offer from Paramount after a seven-day window to renew talks with the Skydance-owned company elapsed Monday.  Paramount confirmed it had submitted this proposal, but neither provided further details on the bid.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Board of Directors Determines Revised Proposal from Paramount Skydance Could Reasonably Be Expected to Lead to a "Company Superior Proposal"
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ("Warner Bros. Discovery" or "WBD") (NASDAQ: WBD) today announced that its Board of Directors (the "Board"), consistent with its fiduciary duties and following consultation with its independent financial and legal advisors, has determined that the revised proposal from Paramount Skydance Corporation ("Paramount Skydance" or "PSKY") (NASDAQ: PSKY) could reasonably be expected to lead to a "Company Superior Proposal" as defined in WBD's merger agreement with Netflix, I
